AngularHelp: Angular is a TypeScript-based, open-source web application framework. [Learn more](https://angular.io/)
CppHelp: C++ is a general-purpose programming language that is used in system/software development and game programming. [Learn more](https://www.cplusplus.com/)
CssHelp: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is a style sheet language used for describing the look and formatting of a document written in HTML. [Learn more](https://www.w3.org/Style/CSS/Overview.en.html)
DockerfileHelp: Dockerfile is a text document that contains all the commands a user could call on the command line to assemble an image using Docker. [Learn more](https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/)
GoHelp: Go, also known as Golang, is a statically typed, compiled programming language designed at Google. It's known for its simplicity and efficiency. [Learn more](https://golang.org/)
GraphqlHelp: GraphQL is an open-source data query and manipulation language for APIs, and a runtime for executing those queries with your existing data. [Learn more](https://graphql.org/)
GroovyHelp: Groovy is a powerful, optionally typed and dynamic language, with static-typing and static compilation capabilities. It's often used for scripting Java applications. [Learn more](http://groovy-lang.org/)
HaskellHelp: Haskell is a statically typed, purely functional programming language with type inference and lazy evaluation. [Learn more](https://www.haskell.org/)
HtmlHelp: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser. [Learn more](https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_intro.asp)
JavaHelp: Java is a class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible. [Learn more](https://www.java.com/)
JavascriptHelp: JavaScript is an interpreted programming language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification. It is widely used in web development. [Learn more](https://www.javascript.com/)
JsonHelp: JSON is a widely used format for storing data objects. [Learn more](https://www.tutorialspoint.com/json/json_quick_guide.htm)
JsonStandardHelp:
We use JSON to define data standards. [Learn more about JSON here](https://www.tutorialspoint.com/json/json_quick_guide.htm). Standards allow us to define the shape of routine outputs, or any other data. To make standards flexible and readable, we support the following:
  - **Variables**: Any key or value can be substituted with a variable. These are used to make it easy for users to fill in their own data, as well as provide details about those parts of the JSON. Variables follow the format of <variable_name>.  
- **Optional fields**: Fields that are not required can be marked as optional. Optional fields must start with a question mark (e.g. ?field_name).  
- **Additional fields**: If an object contains arbitrary fields, add a field with brackets (e.g. [variable]).  
- **Data types**: Data types are specified by reserved words (e.g. <string>, <number | boolean>, <any>, etc.), variable names (e.g. <variable_name>), standard IDs (e.g. <decdf6c8-4230-4777-b8e3-799df2503c42>), or simply entered as normal JSON.
NginxHelp: NGINX is an open source reverse proxy server for HTTP, HTTPS, SMTP, POP3, and IMAP protocols, as well as a load balancer, HTTP cache, and a web server. [Learn more](https://www.nginx.com/)
NixHelp: Nix is a powerful package manager for Linux and other Unix systems that makes package management reliable and reproducible. [Learn more](https://nixos.org/)
PhpHelp: PHP (Hypertext Preprocessor) is a popular general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited to web development. [Learn more](https://www.php.net/)
PlaintextHelp: Plaintext is any data that is 100% human-readable. It is not formatted in any way. [Learn more](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plain_text)
PowershellHelp: PowerShell is a cross-platform task automation and configuration management framework, consisting of a command-line shell and scripting language. [Learn more](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/)
ProtobufHelp: Protocol Buffers (Protobuf) is a method of serializing structured data, useful for transmitting data over the wire or storing it. It's developed by Google. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers)
PuppetHelp: Puppet is an open-source software configuration management and deployment tool. It's most commonly used on Linux and Windows to pull the strings on multiple application servers at once. [Learn more](https://puppet.com/)
PythonHelp: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language. It emphasizes code readability, with its notable use of significant whitespace. [Learn more](https://www.python.org/)
RHelp: R is a language and environment for statistical computing and graphics. It provides a wide variety of statistical and graphical techniques. [Learn more](https://www.r-project.org/)
RubyHelp: Ruby is a dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. It has an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write. [Learn more](https://www.ruby-lang.org/)
RustHelp: Rust is a multi-paradigm programming language designed for performance and safety, especially safe concurrency. It's used for system programming and web assembly applications. [Learn more](https://www.rust-lang.org/)
SassHelp: Sass (Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets) is a preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into Cascading Style Sheets (CSS). [Learn more](https://sass-lang.com/)
ShellHelp: Shell scripting is writing a series of command for the shell to execute. It can combine lengthy and repetitive sequences of commands into a single, simple script. [Learn more](https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/)
SolidityHelp: Solidity is an object-oriented programming language for writing smart contracts. It is used for implementing smart contracts on various blockchain platforms, most notably, Ethereum. [Learn more](https://soliditylang.org/)
SpreadsheetHelp: Spreadsheets are files made of rows and columns that help sort, organize, and arrange data efficiently. They can also perform calculations on data. [Learn more](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spreadsheet)
SqlHelp: SQL (Structured Query Language) is a standard language for managing and manipulating relational databases. [Learn more](https://www.w3schools.com/sql/)
SvelteHelp: Svelte is a new way to build web applications. It's a compiler that takes your declarative components and converts them into efficient JavaScript that surgically updates the DOM. [Learn more](https://svelte.dev/)
SwiftHelp: Swift is a powerful and intuitive programming language for macOS, iOS, watchOS, and tvOS. It's designed to give developers more freedom than ever. [Learn more](https://swift.org/)
TypescriptHelp: TypeScript is an open-source language which builds on JavaScript, one of the world's most used tools, by adding static type definitions. [Learn more](https://www.typescriptlang.org/)
VbHelp: Visual Basic is a third-generation event-driven programming language and integrated development environment (IDE) from Microsoft. [Learn more](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/visual-basic/)
VbscriptHelp: VBScript is an Active Scripting language developed by Microsoft, modeled on Visual Basic. It's primarily used for server-side processing of web pages. [Learn more](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions//d1wf56tt%28v=vs.85%29)
VerilogHelp: Verilog is a hardware description language used to model electronic systems. It's most commonly used in the design and verification of digital circuits. [Learn more](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Verilog)
VhdlHelp: VHDL (VHSIC Hardware Description Language) is a hardware description language used in electronic design automation to describe digital and mixed-signal systems such as field-programmable gate arrays and integrated circuits. [Learn more](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VHDL)
VueHelp: Vue.js is an open-source model–view–viewmodel JavaScript framework for building user interfaces and single-page applications. [Learn more](https://vuejs.org/)
XmlHelp: XML (eXtensible Markup Language) is a markup language that defines a set of rules for encoding documents in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable. [Learn more](https://www.w3.org/XML/)
YacasHelp: Yacas is an easy to use, general-purpose Computer Algebra System, a program for symbolic manipulation of mathematical expressions. [Learn more](http://www.yacas.org/)
YamlHelp: YAML (YAML Ain't Markup Language) is a human-friendly data serialization standard for all programming languages. It is commonly used for configuration files and in applications where data is being stored or transmitted. [Learn more](https://yaml.org/)
